author: Chad
title: Native Token API for Game Devs
description: Gamers want to trade their in-game currencies between games or even between crypto or fiat currencies, but it is too hard for devs to allow.

assessments.note: If successful this would create a good resource to bring more devs into the space
This would be very beneficial for developers using token based in game assets. The drawback would be the high funding request that may limit other equally beneficial proposals to get funding.

Potentially opening up the Cardano ecosystem to game developers by creating a bridge that would motivate them to implement blockchain technology could have long lasting, very positive impacts on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Developing tools to facilitate that bridge addresses the brief of this challenge head-on by creating an easier working environment to engage with and giving them reason to become an active developer on the Cardano platform.
I strongly agree. Future Games like 'Star Citizen' need this kind of economy mechanics.

Havin an easy-to-use API with great documentation, videos, & example games that allow Game Developers to create their own in game currency would be a great enrichment for the Cardano ecosystem. I deduct 1 star because of the criteria in challenge: "What are the the tools that we need to prioritize first" Having the ability to create and trade in-game currencies is not a "basic functionality".
Well detailed proposal. Big project, hard to assess whether the proposer can pull it off.
The proposer seems to be proficient on the development side, and attending the plutus pioneers speaks for this as well. What is more uncertain is the marketing and advertising part.
assessments.reply: Not a big deal, but marketing isn't included in this proposal, as that will be an additional proposal around fund 8 as mentioned in this proposal

assessments.note: The project seems to be very well thought out and meticulously planned. The proposer's previous experience as a game developer, educator and API specialist is confidence inspiring that this project will be successfully implemented. My only concern is that the roadmap and expected implementation seems a bit overly optimistic for a one-man endeavour, I would have liked to see plans to bring on a least one extra developer, part time or on a volunteer basis.

I mostly agree. The writing is easy to follow and understand. Only one thing I would like to see is an experimental stage of the system when these 2 games are online, especially my concerns are on the security side of these 'Currency Servers'- from what I understand these kind of servers exist and you are familiar with these concepts, but it is unclear to me if you are fully qualified to create and manage these by yourself. As mentioned, the roadmap is extensive but there is no sandbox period to test the security of the system. I would like to see more documentation on these concepts. Also one more thing is not fully clear to me, this in game currency, how will it be denominated? I think this must be defind clearly before even making an API. And if it is in most likely event pegged to a Fiat currency then this needs more regulative understanding and clearence. In general, my two concerns are for non-blockchain server security and in-game currency implementation (concepts, issuance, governance). I agree that this proposal will be implemented successfully if my concernes are addressed.
The presented curriculum vitae is very impressive. combined with the detailed description of the delivery objects, there is no doubt that the proposal will be implemented.
Nice proposal detail what needs to be done. It is a big project so feasibility with one person who is new to Cardano is a risk.
A very well written proposal that contains all information I need to make a good assessment.

The proposer's honesty and ability to self evaluate the time and effort needed to successfully execute the proposal is a very positive sign that implies a level of thoroughness that will definitely make the auditing process easier. The roadmap is extremely clear and the community members doing the auditing have an exact picture of what to expect and when.

Mostly clear and understandable with clear roadmap, and it is likely to create definitive points for milestones, but for this complex milestone list the proposer did not include possible risks or dificulties, especially because I am missing explanation of game currency servers. I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

The roadmap is incredibly detailed and would allow easy audit of the progress. the budget is not itemized, but it is defined that the listed tasks will be completed in 10 months and that, in combination with the detailed listing of the tasks, is absolutely exemplary.

solution: Create an easy-to-use API with great documentation, videos, & example games that allow Game Developers to create their own in game currency
experience: Full stack Developer; Game Developer, Gamer, Author and Video Trainer. Understand API Design and security around APIs.
